DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.
RESPONSE TEXT: Are you... you're serious? Just be warned, this ain't no walk in the park.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Here. Take this password and find the office with the control terminal. Power up those rails, and you can see for yourself.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You tried to lure me into a death trap? You're a dead man.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh come on, I was just doing my job!
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Here. Take this password and find the office with the control terminal. Power up those rails, and you can see for yourself.
SCRIPT NOTES: About to start combat with player. / Afraid

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds like typical Raiders to me.
RESPONSE TEXT: You don't get it. These Raiders are different. They make Commonwealth Raiders look like a bunch of kids.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Here. Take this password and find the office with the control terminal. Power up those rails, and you can see for yourself.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why do you help them?
RESPONSE TEXT: Besides not wanting to die, I'm not the only one they got stuck under their thumb. If I don't pull through, their lives are at stake just like mine.
I figure what's some stranger's life compared to those of people I know and care about...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you... you're serious? Just be warned, this ain't no walk in the park.
RESPONSE TEXT: Here. Take this password and find the office with the control terminal. Power up those rails, and you can see for yourself.
Just don't say I didn't warn you. As for me, I'm getting as far away from this place as possible.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: Here, take this. It's the password to the monorail control terminal.
RESPONSE TEXT: The fastest way to get to Nuka-World is to take the Nuka-Express, but I shut it down so those bastards couldn't follow me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Find the control terminal in the office to power it back up... and hurry. God knows how much time they have left.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: Here, take this. It's the password to the monorail control terminal.
RESPONSE TEXT: The fastest way to get to Nuka-World is to take the Nuka-Express, but I shut it down to help sell my story.
Makes it more believable if I say I'm trying to keep the Raiders at bay.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Find the control terminal in the office to power it back up... and hurry. God knows how much time they have left.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: The fastest way to get to Nuka-World is to take the Nuka-Express, but I shut it down so those bastards couldn't follow me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Find the control terminal in the office to power it back up... and hurry. God knows how much time they have left.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: The fastest way to get to Nuka-World is to take the Nuka-Express, but I shut it down so those bastards couldn't follow me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Find the control terminal in the office to power it back up... and once you're on your way, be careful.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Oh, thank God.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just don't let on that you know. They're sick. Half their fun comes from watching the victims realize they've been tricked.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Here, take this. It's the password to the monorail control terminal.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No really. I have enough. Take it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Damn it. Look... you got me. I ain't injured, okay? I just can't do this anymore. The Raiders back at Nuka-World put me up to this.
They lure people in and they kill 'em for fun, and I'm done doing their dirty work. Let 'em find me and do what they want.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: No really. I have enough. Take it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Jesus, they're running out of time. Please, just go! If not for them, do it for the caps. I can pay you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Fine. It's your funeral.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey, I'm not crazy. My family may need that stimpak more than me. I can't risk it. Now, please, just find them. If not for them, for the caps.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Fine. It's your funeral.
RESPONSE TEXT: You think I want to die? I can't risk it. By the time you got help, they could be dead, so please... just find them. I can pay you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help. I'll go face them. You don't have to die.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.
RESPONSE TEXT: No, no... I'll be fine. Save it for my wife and kid, for Lisa and Cody.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: No really. I have enough. Take it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.
RESPONSE TEXT: No. There's no time for that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: No really. I have enough. Take it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Your family is probably dead.
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't say that. I won't give up on them. I can't.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: You're here for a reason. You've got to be.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's what trust gets you out here in the Commonwealth.
RESPONSE TEXT: Sometimes hope kicks you while you're down. But sometimes... it lends you a hand.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: You're here for a reason. You've got to be.
SCRIPT NOTES: Regretful. Referring to the player when he says, "it lends you a hand" as if Hope brought the player to him. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Nuka-World is still up and running? I remember that place.
RESPONSE TEXT: I wouldn't say it's still running. The place is run down, but those Raiders sure got it made.
Plenty of supplies, clean water, guns... Oh God. I never should have left.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.
SCRIPT NOTES: Starting to lose it, emotionally. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Nuka-World is still up and running? I remember that place.
RESPONSE TEXT: There's not very many of them. Four maybe? Five? And with the amount of jet they were doing to celebrate, it was easy.
I picked the lock on the cage they had me in, but one of them came barreling in before I was able to free my wife and son.
My wife, Lisa, told me to run, so I did. Now I just got to hope it's not too late to save them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.

RESPONSE TEXT: Where are you going? I need help here!
SCRIPT NOTES: Player walked away. Desperate for help. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Come on. Don't walk away!
SCRIPT NOTES: Player walked away. Desperate for help. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: No, no, don't leave!
SCRIPT NOTES: Player walked away. Desperate for help. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Jesus. Shit. They're gonna die.
SCRIPT NOTES: Injured and scared. Mumbling to himself. / Nervous

RESPONSE TEXT: Goddamn Raiders. I should have known.
SCRIPT NOTES: Injured and scared. Mumbling to himself. / Nervous

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh God, they're going to kill them... I know it.
SCRIPT NOTES: Injured and desperate for help because his family is in danger. "Going to" like "gonna" / Nervous

RESPONSE TEXT: This is all my fault. All my fault.
SCRIPT NOTES: Injured and scared. Mumbling to himself. / Nervous

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They fooled us... big time.
RESPONSE TEXT: My family and I ran into some traders a while back... told us they knew a safe settlement... at Nuka-World. But when we got there...
SCRIPT NOTES: Relaying what happened through injury. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Found out they were Raiders the whole time, just stringing us along.
I managed to escape, but my wife and son are still back there. I wanted to get some help and go back for them, but didn't count on taking a bullet.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.
SCRIPT NOTES: Explaining the situation through the pain. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Tell me what happened.
RESPONSE TEXT: They fooled us... big time.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: My family and I ran into some traders a while back... told us they knew a safe settlement... at Nuka-World. But when we got there...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I only help myself. What's in it for me?
RESPONSE TEXT: I can pay you. You bring them back safe, and I'll give you everything I have. Just hear me out.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: My family and I ran into some traders a while back... told us they knew a safe settlement... at Nuka-World. But when we got there...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You look terrible.
RESPONSE TEXT: Tell me about it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: My family and I ran into some traders a while back... told us they knew a safe settlement... at Nuka-World. But when we got there...
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight humor through the pain. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you okay?
RESPONSE TEXT: Hell, I've seen better days, but it's my family I'm really worried about. Once those Raiders realize I'm gone...
I don't even want to think about what they'll do to them. God, you've got to help me.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: My family and I ran into some traders a while back... told us they knew a safe settlement... at Nuka-World. But when we got there...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, thank God.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: Just don't let on that you know. They're sick. Half their fun comes from watching the victims realize they've been tricked.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How do I know this isn't just another trick?
RESPONSE TEXT: I guess you'll just have to trust me. Not like I can prove myself one way or another.
So, will you do it or not?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How do I know this isn't just another trick?
RESPONSE TEXT: I'd stay put. They'd know something's up if I went with. Does this mean you'll do it?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How do I know this isn't just another trick?
RESPONSE TEXT: Just leave me. My wife and kid are all that matters, you hear me? Tell me you'll do this.
Does this mean you'll do it?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Don't say that. I won't give up on them. I can't.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're here for a reason. You've got to be.
I turned on a transmitter here, hoping someone would come. I didn't think it'd work, but here you are.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: It's got to be a sign, right? So please, I'm begging you. They're running out of time.
SCRIPT NOTES: Explaining the situation through the pain. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: I turned on a transmitter here, hoping someone would come. I didn't think it'd work, but here you are.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's got to be a sign, right? So please, I'm begging you. They're running out of time.
If not for them, do it for the caps. You bring them back safe, I can pay you. I swear.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Harvey: Just don't let on that you know. They're sick. Half their fun comes from watching the victims realize they've been tricked.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Harvey: The fastest way to get to Nuka-World is to take the Nuka-Express, but I shut it down so those bastards couldn't follow me.

RESPONSE TEXT: It wasn't supposed to go down this way!
Damn it!
What the hell?
Come on. Say something.

RESPONSE TEXT: Damn it. Please don't be another crazy.
SCRIPT NOTES: Waiting for player to speak. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Jesus, this hurts.
SCRIPT NOTES: Grunt at the beginning. Waiting for player to speak. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Good luck. You'll need it.
Hope you're packing plenty of ammo.
Can't say I didn't warn you.
Find the control terminal. The power should be easy to restart.
Come on, that monorail ain't going to power itself. Get to the terminal.
Quit wasting time and get that power on.
I told you not to worry about me. Just find the terminal and get the power back on to get to Nuka-World.
Hurry, before it's too late.
What are you waiting for? Go find them.
You're still here? Move it, before it's too late!
Make sure you're ready to deal with those Raiders before you get on that monorail. They ain't no joke.
It's no small thing you're doing for me. I won't forget it.
I'll be keeping my fingers crossed for you.
Raiders, that's what. Those bastards have my family. You... you gotta help me. Please.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Tell me what happened.
SCRIPT NOTES: Injured and desperate for help because his family is in danger. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: You're back... Hope that means you're here to help.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Tell me what happened.
SCRIPT NOTES: Player returned after walking away. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Well? Are you helping or not?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Let me help you first. I have a stimpak.
SCRIPT NOTES: Player returned after walking away. / InPain

RESPONSE TEXT: Come on. Can you help me or not?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: All right. I'll help you.
SCRIPT NOTES: Player returned after walking away. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Keep up the good work, Harvey.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'll keep packing 'em in and the Gauntlet can keep picking 'em off.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Well, I'm the Overboss, and I say you're free to go.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You need to be more convincing.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey, I got you in there, didn't I? One way or another, I'll keep 'em coming.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Well, I'm the Overboss, and I say you're free to go.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Nervous

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Why do you stick around and keep doing this?
RESPONSE TEXT: Are you kidding? If I split, people I know get hurt. I can handle screwing over a stranger, but not people I care about.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Well, I'm the Overboss, and I say you're free to go.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Tired

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Faking injury again?
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, I guess it's all I'm good at. Since I fooled you, the gang leaders seem to think I've got some sort of special talent... suckers.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Keep up the good work, Harvey.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Well, I'm the Overboss, and I say you're free to go.
RESPONSE TEXT: You... You're serious, aren't you? I ain't gonna say no, and believe me, it'll be a cold day in hell if you see me in the Commonwealth again.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: They're all dead anyway. They just don't know it yet.
RESPONSE TEXT: You're a real ray of sunshine, boss. Guess I'll see you around.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Amused

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Caring is a mistake, Harv. Makes you weak.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, yeah. Maybe someday I'll learn that lesson, but for now, I guess I'm stuck here.
SCRIPT NOTES: Trying to sound proud, but he's a tortured man (emotionally and physically). / Tired

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you saying you don't approve of our methods?
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm just saying I'm tired. I'm down with doing whatever it takes to live to see another day.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Well, I'm the Overboss, and I say you're free to go.

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, thank God. The Raiders have my fam -- Oh, hey, boss.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Keep up the good work, Harvey.
SCRIPT NOTES: Pretending to be injured until he notices the player. Then he speaks normally. / InPain

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04Harvey: I don't have any family...living family. I lost them when Colter and his gangs took this place from us.
RESPONSE TEXT: Now, these traders are all I have left. They're my family now.
Every time Colter sent me out to lure people into The Gauntlet, I didn't have a choice. I had to do it or he'd kill someone I cared about.
I'm just... sorry you had to get caught up in all this.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It's all right, Harvey. I understand.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCMHarvey: Hey, boss. Looks like you really lit this place up.
RESPONSE TEXT: Surprised to hear the Disciples actually thought they could take you on. Believe me, I won't miss 'em.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're better off. We're stronger this way.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCMHarvey: Hey, boss. Looks like you really lit this place up.
RESPONSE TEXT: Surprised to hear the Operators actually thought they could take you on. Believe me, I won't miss 'em.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're better off. We're stronger this way.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCMHarvey: Hey, boss. Looks like you really lit this place up.
RESPONSE TEXT: Surprised to hear the Pack actually thought they could take you on. Believe me, I won't miss 'em.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're better off. We're stronger this way.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: We're better off. We're stronger this way.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ain't no one going to argue that now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: It sure is nice to have electrical power around here, though. Should keep us safe and bring more business to Nuka-World.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Good riddance. They were weak.
RESPONSE TEXT: As long as it ain't us, I'm happy.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: It sure is nice to have electrical power around here, though. Should keep us safe and bring more business to Nuka-World.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I guess this means one less boss to push you guys around.
RESPONSE TEXT: Heh. I guess that is a sort of victory for us traders.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: It sure is nice to have electrical power around here, though. Should keep us safe and bring more business to Nuka-World.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Speaking of which, have you seen any stragglers? When I clean house, I like to be thorough.
RESPONSE TEXT: Haven't seen any of 'em since they went for the Power Plant.
If there are any left, you'd think they'd be smart enough to get as far from Nuka-World as they could.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: We're better off. We're stronger this way.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Ain't no one going to argue that now.
RESPONSE TEXT: It sure is nice to have electrical power around here, though. Should keep us safe and bring more business to Nuka-World.
And yeah, yeah... I know you didn't do it for us, but the traders feel like it's a real improvement anyway.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: That's why I did it. It benefits everyone.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's why I did it. It benefits everyone.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah, boss. Well, best get back to work. Don't want to look like I'm slacking on the job.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Quit yapping and get back to work.
RESPONSE TEXT: Don't gotta tell me twice.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm so glad the traders approve, I was hoping to win their popularity contest.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just thought you'd like to know, is all. And don't worry, I'm getting my ass back to work.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Do you have anything interesting to say? Or are you just wasting my time?
RESPONSE TEXT: And on that note, I'll just get my ass back to work.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC04NPCMHarvey: Holy shit, boss. That was some reckoning you pulled off.
RESPONSE TEXT: I never thought I'd say it, but I sure am glad you ended up at Nuka-World.
That year we spent under those Raiders won't be easy to forget, but I never even dreamed we'd be getting out of this with our freedom.
We owe you so much, I don't even know where to begin... besides saying thanks.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Don't worry, Harvey. You're welcome.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I hate Raiders. Those parasites deserved exactly what they got.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hell, I won't argue with you there.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: Maybe now we can restore this place back to its former glory. A fair trading post with good people.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You don't owe me anything.
RESPONSE TEXT: You've no idea. If you ask me, we owe you our lives.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: Maybe now we can restore this place back to its former glory. A fair trading post with good people.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What'll you do now?
RESPONSE TEXT: I haven't even taken a moment to think about that.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: Maybe now we can restore this place back to its former glory. A fair trading post with good people.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Hell, I won't argue with you there.
RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe now we can restore this place back to its former glory. A fair trading post with good people.
And once word spreads about what you did here, no way any Raiders are going to think about touching this place any time soon.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Thank God. If it's any consolation, I'm glad you made it.
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't have any family...living family. I lost them when Colter and his gangs took this place from us.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: Now, these traders are all I have left. They're my family now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Thank God. If it's any consolation, I'm glad you made it.
RESPONSE TEXT: I lost my real family when Colter and his gangs took this place from us.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: Now, these traders are all I have left. They're my family now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's all right, Harvey. I understand.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good to hear, boss. Never figured I'd find myself in this situation before. I thought for sure I'd be a goner. Well, better get back to it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Whatever. I don't need to hear your boring sob story.
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey, as long as we're cool, man. I don't want any trouble.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Did you ever fail to bring someone in?
RESPONSE TEXT: Never. Couldn't afford to. It used to be me and another guy they'd send out. He thought he'd try and escape while he was out there...
They found him and made him watch as they tortured and killed two of our own. Then they sent him through the Gauntlet themselves.
After that, the choice was obvious. Like I said, I'm sorry you got caught up in all this.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It's all right, Harvey. I understand.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It's okay. I get it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thank God. If it's any consolation, I'm glad you made it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: I don't have any family...living family. I lost them when Colter and his gangs took this place from us.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You lied to me.
RESPONSE TEXT: I know, and I'm sorry. But if you ever cared about anyone, you'd do the same thing.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DLC04Harvey: I don't have any family...living family. I lost them when Colter and his gangs took this place from us.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You were in on this?
RESPONSE TEXT: Yeah... pretty much. But it's not what you think. I mean it's... it's just I didn't really have any choice in the matter.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It's okay. I get it.
SCRIPT NOTES: Uneasy - Admitting to tricking the player into entering a death trap. / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You were in on this?
RESPONSE TEXT: Hey, I may be surprised, but in a good way, all right? Just because I got you in here doesn't mean I didn't regret it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: It's okay. I get it.
SCRIPT NOTES: Uneasy - Hoping the player doesn't kill him for tricking her. / Concerned

Boss.
Another wonderful day in Nuka-Town USA.

Don't worry. Someone will come along soon enough.

Finally some real freedom. I gotta admit, you make it hard for me to regret luring you in there a while back.
